intro: Silene krantzii, commonly known as Krantz's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Silene krantzii is often found in sagebrush habitats and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
